üìë Pandanus (screwpine)...commonly known as pandan leaves...used widely in South Asian and Southeast Asian cooking as a flavoring. 

Characteristic aroma of pandan is caused by the aroma compound...which may give white bread, jasmine rice and basmati rice...their typical smell | ...a nutty, botanical fragrance | used as a flavor enhancer in Indian...Malaysian...Philippine cuisines... especially in rice dishes, desserts and cakes. - en.wikipedia.org

Various Aroma Descriptions: Combo of nutty, milky oolong, almond cream & jasmine rice | warm & subtle sweetness *Compare to Fresh Pandan or Frozen @ Asian Food Market
